skill.name: water-rights-fishing
skill.description: Clerk for water licenses, irrigation, riparian rights, and fishing restrictions affecting Pukaist/Nlaka'pamux territories
skill.summary: Process water license applications and fishing regulations for Indigenous territories
skill.author: ACSKamloops

security_audit.summary: Static analysis flagged 82 potential issues with risk score 100/100. All findings evaluated as false positives from pattern matching on documentation content. The skill contains only instructional documentation (SKILL.md) with example command snippets showing how to use an external Python workflow script. No executable code present. References to PowerShell, SAM database, and crypto patterns are artifacts from scanning example command strings and JSON structure markers. Skill is safe for publication.

content.user_title: Process water rights and fishing regulations efficiently
content.value_statement: Administrative workflows for water licenses and fishing restrictions require specialized knowledge of regional Indigenous territory regulations. This skill helps clerks efficiently navigate complex water rights and fishing regulations for Pukaist and Nlaka'pamux territories.
actual_capabilities: Process water license applications for agricultural and domestic use
Verify irrigation permits against regional water allocation rules
Check fishing restrictions and seasonal closures for affected waterways
Research riparian rights claims and priority dates
Maintain records for Water_Rights_Fishing queue processing
Extract metadata from legal documents including dates, titles, and provenance
limitations: Does not provide legal advice on water disputes or rights claims
Cannot override official government determinations or approvals
Limited to Pukaist and Nlaka'pamux territorial regulations only
Does not access real-time water quality, flow data, or environmental testing

use_cases.title: Process incoming water license applications
use_cases.description: Review and categorize water license applications for the queue, checking for required documentation and regional compliance with territorial regulations.
use_cases.target_user: Municipal clerks processing water rights applications

use_cases.title: Verify fishing restrictions for permit requests
use_cases.description: Check proposed activities against current fishing regulations, seasonal closures, protected species requirements, and Indigenous territorial restrictions.
use_cases.target_user: Indigenous community land managers and environmental officers

use_cases.title: Research irrigation permit history and priority dates
use_cases.description: Look up historical irrigation permits, priority dates, water allocation records, and riparian rights claims for specific properties within territorial boundaries.
use_cases.target_user: Regional water management officers and legal researchers

prompt_templates.title: New water license application
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this water license application for the Pukaist territory. Check if all required documents are attached and flag any compliance issues with current irrigation regulations.
prompt_templates.scenario: Processing a new application in the Water_Rights_Fishing queue

prompt_templates.title: Fishing restriction lookup
prompt_templates.prompt: What are the current fishing restrictions for the Thompson River within Nlaka'pamux territory? Include any seasonal closures, catch limits, and protected species restrictions.
prompt_templates.scenario: Answering a fishing restriction inquiry from permit applicant

prompt_templates.title: Riparian rights verification
prompt_templates.prompt: Research the riparian rights status for property along the Bonaparte River. Include priority date, water allocation limits, and any conflicting claims on record.
prompt_templates.scenario: Verifying existing water rights for a property before approval

prompt_templates.title: Irrigation permit compliance check
prompt_templates.prompt: Check this irrigation permit application against the regional water allocation matrix for Pukaist Creek watershed. Flag any exceedances of annual allocation limits and document priority conflicts.
prompt_templates.scenario: Reviewing permit compliance before final approval decision

output_examples.input: What are the fishing restrictions on Nicola Lake until October 2024?
output_examples.output:
Nicola Lake fishing restrictions effective until October 31, 2024:

- Catch limit: 2 trout per day maximum
- Night fishing prohibited (10 PM - 5 AM)
- Barbless hooks required for all catch-and-release
- Protected species: Bull trout - all catch-and-release only, no retention
- Seasonal closure begins November 1 for spawning protection

Verify current regulations with Fisheries and Oceans Canada before enforcement.

best_practices: Always verify the applicable territory (Pukaist vs Nlaka'pamux) before processing requests to ensure correct regulatory framework
Check for recent regulatory updates and seasonal changes before citing specific limits or closure dates
Document all sources, reference numbers, and page citations for complete audit trails and legal defensibility
anti_patterns: Do not provide definitive legal interpretations of water rights disputes without proper legal authority
Do not approve permits that exceed stated allocation limits or violate priority date hierarchies
Do not rely solely on outdated fishing regulation summaries without verifying current status

faq.question: What territories does this skill cover?
faq.answer: This skill covers water rights and fishing regulations for Pukaist and Nlaka'pamux traditional territories in British Columbia, Canada. It does not cover other Indigenous territories or provinces.

faq.question: Can this skill approve water licenses or permits?
faq.answer: No. This skill assists with processing, research, and documentation but does not have authority to approve permits or override official government decisions. All approvals require proper legal authority.

faq.question: How current is the fishing regulation data?
faq.answer: This skill provides information based on documented regulations in the system. Always verify with official Fisheries and Oceans Canada sources for enforcement purposes and current seasonal restrictions.

faq.question: Does this skill handle water quality testing or environmental data?
faq.answer: No. This skill focuses on regulatory and administrative aspects of water rights and fishing permits, not environmental testing, water quality analysis, or real-time flow monitoring.

faq.question: What priority system is used for water rights allocation?
faq.answer: First-in-time, first-in-right priority system applies under riparian rights doctrine. Earlier priority dates have superior rights during allocation disputes and drought conditions.

faq.question: Can this skill help with groundwater or well drilling permits?
faq.answer: This skill can provide general information about groundwater permitting requirements and allocation rules but does not directly process well drilling permits or groundwater licensing applications.
